title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of Nutrition & Food Classification
description: Assess your understanding of basic nutrition concepts, definitions, and food classification systems.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines 'Nutrients'?

options.text: Substances causing disease in the human body
Substances digested and absorbed to promote body functions
The basic duty to provide adequate food to patients
The balance between intake and requirements

questions.explanation: Nutrients are specifically defined as substances which are digested and absorbed to promote body functions.
questions.hint: Think about what the body absorbs from food.

questions.question: Match the food classification with its primary function:

pairs.right: Balance between nutrient intake and requirement

questions.explanation: Energy foods (carbs) fuel work; Body building (proteins) build tissue; Protective (vitamins) fight disease.
questions.hint: Connect the food type to what it does for the body.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is a condition caused by lack of, inadequate, or excess intake of nutrients, while ___BLANK___ refers to the study of nutrients in food and how the body uses them.
questions.explanation: Malnutrition refers to poor nutrition (under or over), while Nutrition is the scientific study of food processes.
questions.hint: The first is a disorder; the second is the subject of this course.

questions.question: Which of the following are classified as 'Protective Foods'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Protective foods help protect the body from diseases and are primarily vitamins found in fruits and vegetables. Maize is energy-giving; beef is body-building.
questions.hint: These foods are rich in vitamins.

questions.question: A single type of food, such as sugar, can provide all the nutrients required by the body in sufficient quantities.
questions.explanation: No single food provides all nutrients required by the body; a variety of foods must be eaten. Sugar contains only one nutrient (carbohydrate).
questions.hint: Can you survive healthily on just sugar?

questions.question: What is the term for the basic duty to provide adequate and appropriate food and drinks to patients?
questions.explanation: Nutritional care is defined as the basic duty to provide adequate and appropriate food and drinks to patients.

questions.question: Read the definition below. Which term does it describe?

richContent.content:
Definition:
These are diseases that occur when a person's dietary intake does not contain the right amount of nutrients for healthy functioning, or when a person cannot correctly absorb nutrients from food.

questions.explanation: Nutritional disorders are diseases resulting from incorrect intake or absorption of nutrients.

questions.hint: Look for plant-based sources in the table.

questions.question: How does good nutrition specifically relate to development in school-going children?

options.text: It decreases their physical activity levels
It negatively influences cognitive development and academic performance
It allows them to reach full potential in learning and mental development
It prevents them from needing sleep

questions.explanation: Good nutrition is important for physical and mental development, allowing people to reach their full potential in school and work.
questions.hint: Think about the positive impact on the brain and learning.

questions.question: Arrange the following nutrients in order of energy density per gram (Highest Energy to Lowest/Equal Energy):
questions.explanation: Fats provide 9kcal/g, while Proteins and Carbohydrates both provide 4kcal/g.
questions.hint: Fats provide more than double the energy of the others.
